item.title: DOM elements or HTML
item.description:
Michael Geary: DOM elements or HTML:
[...]
Would you like to share your code? I was just thinking about adding an HTML output option to the DOM creation plugin. :-)
There is a little-known but serious memory leak involving innerHTML. It happens when you mix DOM creation with innerHTML in a pattern like this:
var e = document. [...]

item.title: Working with radio elements
item.description:
Andrea Ca'Zorzi: Working with radio elements: Then it's
$("#foo_" + this.value + "_bar")
Happy jquerying...
Andrea
On 3/22/06, jquery at vikas.mailshell.com <jquery at vikas.mailshell.com> wrote:
[...]

item.title: Working with radio elements
item.description:
jquery at vikas.mailshell.com: Working with radio elements: Thanks a lot.
[...]
In my case, as I said, the DOM id has the radio input value embedded in it.
So, the radio value is dom1 while the DOM node is is foo_dom1_bar. So, I guess I would need a regular expression match in the jQuery expression above? Does jQuery support this? [...]

item.title: Working with radio elements
item.description: Andrea Ca'Zorzi: Working with radio elements: You'll need to identify the radio buttons, let's say they are all called videoKillsTheRadioStar Then you need to express the dependency between one particular radio button and a dom node. Let's say you do that by assigning the id of the dom node to the value of the radio button, like this: [...]

item.title: DOM elements or HTML
item.description:
Klaus Hartl: DOM elements or HTML: Hi Frank and all,
innerHtml is not a standard defined by the W3C. A browser, that claims to be DOM compliant therefore does not need to support innerHtml, but it's required to support document.create et al.
In real world any major browser supports innerHtml. Maybe its becoming a standard. [...]

item.title: DOM elements or HTML
item.description:
Franck Marcia: DOM elements or HTML: Hi all,
I made an extensive use of append, prepend or before methods and of the jquery-dom library of Michael Geary (http://mg.to/2006/02/27/easy-dom-creation-for-jquery-and-prototype).
But, according to PPK (http://www.quirksmode.org/index.html?/dom/innerhtml. [...]

item.title: event selectors?
event selectors?
item.description:
Armand Datema: event selectors?: http://encytemedia.com/event-selectors/
just found this, does jquuery have something like this?
Armand

item.title: Working with radio elements
item.description:
jquery at vikas.mailshell.com: Working with radio elements: I have 3 radio inputs with values, say, One, Two and Three
There is a DOM node (getElementById) associated with each of these values, call them, Node_One, Node_Two and Node_Three. i.e. the DOM id has the radio input value embedded in it.
When radio input One is selected, I would like to show Node_One and hide the other two. When radio input Two is selected, I would like to show Node_Two and hide the other two and so on.
How can I do this with jQuery?
Thanks

item.title: version
item.description:
Franck Marcia: version: John,
I would like to ask (nicely) if you could set $().$jquery each time jQuery evolves.
For the moment, I use WinMerge to check if something new is available. It'd be easier to look at a version number!
Cheers,
Franck.

item.title: parents() function
item.description:
John Resig: parents() function: Excellent - that's exactly what I was trying to get the current parents() function to do, before I managed to bork it and then get caught up in work. Currently I have it named .ancestors() in my mini-spec, but I may change it: http://jquery.com/docs/NewFunctions/
One down, many to go! [...]

Three elements are selected, but only one get the div tag appended. [...]

item.title: Accordion implementation
item.description:
Franck Marcia: Accordion implementation: The problem only occurs with FF.
With IE, it blinks but the size doesn't change.
Franck.

item.title: Accordion implementation
item.description:
John Resig: Accordion implementation: Currently the fx animations keep growing if you use borders and/or padding, unfortunately. That's a known Mozilla bug :-/ I'll figure out some way to circumvent it. On 3/21/06, Franck Marcia <franck.marcia at gmail.com> wrote:
[...]
jeresig at gmail. [...]

item.title: Accordion implementation
item.description:
Franck Marcia: Accordion implementation: I've just uploaded a more "secured" accordion which behaves correctly with double clicks and avoid simultaneous animations: http://fmarcia.info/jquery/accordion.html.
On this example, I added paddings and borders, trying to avoid these annoying blinks... [...]

item.title: roadmap for jquery and better example / vertical example of accordeon
item.description:
Armand Datema: roadmap for jquery and better example / vertical example of accordeon: Hi
I have an idea for a tutoial, I would liek to comvert over some of my code to jqury plugins. But since I learn best by example it would be great if we had a tutorial on " How to convert your excisting code to jquery plugin"
Right now I finished the beginning of a small path animation libary that I would like to extend on and make into plgin for jquery but I am not quite sure where to start.
Also is there some sort of roadmap for jquery so we can see what in planning/development?
The accordeon sample, it flickers a lot with me on ie6, while other accordean examples like rico or moofx are very smooth. So is this not yet possible with jquery to get it that smooth?
btw did anyone ever made a vertical ccordeon like http://www.schwingnuke.com/dhtml/accordeonh/sample.html
please dont look at the code I did this about 4 years back before all the cool libraries and mentionings of unobtrosive javascript were nowhere to be seen :)
But i always had plans to make this into a more robust version but lack of time so if there are any takers go ahead
Armand

item.title: Accordion implementation
item.description:
jk: Accordion implementation: I have Firefox blinking every now and again when the accordion fx is activated. It looks like it has to do with the scrollbars. I didn't try it in any other browser.
I also thought I'd play a bit and see if the accordion effect was protected from the double-click ".slideup/. [...]
